segments.text: I see the woman drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even flinch as the water soaks her shoes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy is balancing on that stool like a little acrobat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her treat like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to be furious when she finally turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is making such a mess, and she’s just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the garden outside, so calm and lovely, but in here, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman is just too tired to notice anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching so high, and I’m scared he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this is a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
